Environment module¶

class Environment.Environment(configs: Dict)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract Environment Class all environments implemented in Shiva inherit from.

step(actions) → None¶

Passes in an action which is in turn passed into the environment to continue the reinforcement training loop.

finished(n_episodes=None) → bool¶

The environment controls when the Learner is done stepping on the Environment Here we evaluate the amount of episodes to be played

start_env() → bool¶

Typically can be used to launch the environment and set some initial values.

get_observation(agent) → None¶

Returns an observation.

get_observations() → None¶

Returns multiple observations.

get_action() → None¶

Returns an action.

get_actions() → None¶

Returns multiple actions.

get_reward() → None¶

Returns the reward stepwise reward.

get_rewards() → None¶

Returns stepwise reward for all the agents.

get_observation_space() → numpy.array¶

Returns the observation space dimension for the environment. :returns: Tuple of integers representing observation dimensions.

get_action_space() → Tuple¶

Returns the action space dimensions for the environment. :returns: Tuple of integers representing the actions dimensions.

get_current_step() → int¶

Returns the current step in the episode. :returns: Current step in the episode.

get_metrics() → None¶

Returns the metrics relevant to the environment. :returns: None

reset() → None¶

Resets the environment state and parameters. :returns: None

load_viewer() → None¶

Loads the environment’s renderer. :returns: None

normalize_reward(reward) → float¶

Used to normalize the reward and multiply it by a factor.

Experimental.

Returns

Normalized reward multiplied by some factor given in the config.

log(msg, verbose_level=- 1) → None¶

If verbose_level is not given, by default will log

Used to output debug messages. :returns: None
